Package edu.citadel.cprl

Class IdTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.citadel.cprl.IdTable
  • public final class IdTable
extends java.lang.Object
    The identifier table (also known as a symbol table) is used to hold attributes of identifiers in the programming language CPRL.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      IdTable()
      Construct an empty identifier table with scope level initialized to 0.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(Declaration decl)
      Add a declaration at the current scope level.
      void closeScope()
      Closes the outermost scope.
      Declaration get​(Token idToken)
      Returns the Declaration associated with the identifier token's text.
      ScopeLevel getCurrentLevel()
      Returns the current scope level.
      void openScope()
      Opens a new scope for identifiers.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • IdTable

        public IdTable()
        Construct an empty identifier table with scope level initialized to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentLevel

        public ScopeLevel getCurrentLevel()
        Returns the current scope level.

      • openScope

        public void openScope()
        Opens a new scope for identifiers.

      • closeScope

        public void closeScope()
        Closes the outermost scope.

      • add

        public void add​(Declaration decl)
         throws ParserException
        Add a declaration at the current scope level.
        Throws:
        ParserException - if the identifier token associated with the declaration is already defined in the current scope.

      • get

        public Declaration get​(Token idToken)
        Returns the Declaration associated with the identifier token's text. Searches enclosing scopes if necessary.
